title: Ha Long Bay
text: Ha Long Bay is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Quang Ninh province, Vietnam. The bay is known for its emerald waters and thousands of towering limestone islands topped with rainforests.

title: Hoi An Ancient Town
text: Hoi An Ancient Town is a well-preserved example of a Southeast Asian trading port dating from the 15th to the 19th century. The town reflects a unique blend of cultures from Vietnam, Japan, and Europe.

title: Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park
text: Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park is famous for its cave systems, including Son Doong, the world's largest cave. The park features impressive karst landscapes and underground rivers.
